article.headline: Toledo 67, Ferris State 55
article.story: TOLEDO, Ohio (AP) -- Justin Ingram scored 13 points to lead Toledo to a 67-55 victory over Ferris State on Saturday night. Sammy Villegas also had 10 points for the Rockets (4-2), who outrebounded the Bulldogs 35-27 and forced 22 turnovers. Terrance Shaw led NCAA Division II Ferris State (5-3) with 15 points. Dennis Springs and Antwuan Holt scored 13 points apiece. Allen Pinson hit a 3-pointer and converted a layup in an 11-0 run that gave Toledo an 18-7 lead with 11:30 left in the first half. The Rockets shot 50 percent from the field to take a 35-25 lead at halftime. Ferris State's Julius Vines scored midway through the second half to cut the lead to 49-45 but Toledo pulled away from there. Ingram made a 3 to give the Rockets a 64-53 advantage with 4:15 remaining. Ingram finished 3-of-5 from the field and 5-of-5 from the free-throw line. Kashif Payne had six assists for the Rockets.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
